==English== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|en|de|mitmachen}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun|?}} # {{lb|en|psychiatry}} A [[state]] in which a person's [[body]] can be put into any [[posture]], although the person has been [[instruct]]ed to [[resist]] any [[movement]]. ===See also=== * {{l|en|mitgehen}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{affix|de|mit-|machen}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ˈmɪtˌmaχən]|[-χɴ̩]}} * {{hyphenation|de|mit|ma|chen}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|macht mit|machte mit|mitgemacht}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[take part]] #: {{ux|de|Ich '''mache''' auch bei schulischen Aktivitäten außerhalb des Unterrichts '''mit'''.|t=I also take part in extracurricular activities.}} ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|mach|gemacht|h|6=mit}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Mitmachen}} * {{l|de|mitmachend}} * {{l|de|mitgemacht}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|durchmachen}} * {{l|de|nachmachen}} * {{l|de|mitgehen}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
